;

;"When I saw it, it felt very similar to what I wanted to say in my heart. I want to take a photo and post it on Moments," Xiaomei told her friend after checking in on the road signs.

;

;Recently, street signs such as "The wind that misses you finally blows to Changsha" and "I miss you in Nanjing" have begun to quietly occupy the streets and alleys - —Young people began to check in on Internet celebrity street signs and rushed to take photos with them.

;

;;

;

;;（IC photo/图）;

;

;Young people began to take pictures of street signs

;

;In She Village, Jiangning District, Nanjing, a "glass plank road landscape platform" where you can see the whole village is set up "I miss you so much in Nanjing" is a road sign. Nowadays, it has become an internet celebrity check-in place for many tourists coming to Nanjing.

;

;"We saw someone sharing this place on social platforms, so we came over to take a look during the weekend." Nanjing citizen Ms. Xia told reporters that she was attracted to What I came here to check in with my best friend was this street sign on the viewing platform.

;

;In fact, not only Nanjing, but also in trendy neighborhoods or scenic areas in many cities, there are such Internet celebrity street signs, and they continue to attract all kinds of people to stop and take photos. In addition to being used by scenic spots, cultural and creative parks, etc. to attract visitors, these street signs are also used by some merchants with keen business sense to regard them as traffic tools to attract the public to stop.

;

;In front of a bakery near the intersection of Zhaolin Street and Shitou Road Street in Daoli District, Harbin, there is a street sign saying "I miss you very much in Harbin". It also caused many passers-by to stop and take photos. Others, such as some milk tea shops, coffee shops, snack shops, etc., have also erected various street signs to attract people.

;

;In addition, some famous landmarks and road signs are also sought after. For example, the Drum Tower street sign in Beijing has become one of the most popular street signs at the moment. In order to hit the Gulou street sign, some young people will even take a hard seat on the train for more than ten hours and then wait in line for two hours to complete the photo.

;

;The popularity of street signs has also become a kind of social currency. So far, the topic "The whole Internet calls for missing you street signs" has been viewed nearly 5 million times on the social platform Xiaohongshu, and has been played more than 670 million times on the short video platform Douyin.

;

;Judging from some social platforms, young people are not only keen to show off their various "Miss You" series of street signs, but also some anti-bone street signs such as "I endure in Chongqing." "You've been around for a long time" and "I'm eating in Xi'an and waiting to die" are also popular.

;

;Ms. Fan, who runs a metal materials factory in Shanghai, said that she started the road sign customization business in 2020. But what I never expected was that the mediocre street signs in the past two years could actually sell out.

;

;"The order volume is increasing year by year, and thousands of street signs are sold a year." Ms. Fan said.

;

;;

;

;;（IC photo/图）;

;

;;Why do young people like to take pictures of street signs? ;

;

;The reason why young people like to take pictures of street signs actually has both environmental and historical origins.

;

;First of all, after the epidemic dissipated, various places ushered in a small rebound in travel, and people began to go to major cities and scenic spots to take photos. In addition, City walks have emerged in various places, and young people have started walking in the city, taking photos while walking.

;

;These trips naturally bring traffic to scenic spots, Internet celebrity spots, streets and alleys, and this traffic is reflected on social platforms, that is, many people take photos of street signs. In other ways, the check-in goal of "I have been here before" was completed.

;

;From a historical perspective, street signs are essentially one of the forms of plaques.

;

;In terms of cultural origins, plaques are an indispensable decoration in Chinese classical architecture. Whether it is a building, a platform, a pavilion, a pavilion, a pavilion, a pavilion, a hall, or a pavilion, plaques are in harmony with the building. They are an essential part of the building and are equivalent to the eyes of the building.

;

;Taking a plaque and showing the inscription on the plaque is the fastest way to convey that you have visited this place or like this place. In front of many historic sites, towers or mountain peaks, whether it is a stone tablet, a foyer plaque or a poem written in calligraphy, the public likes to take photos. This in itself is a self-evident awareness.

;

;Although today's street signs have changed in form and text compared to inscriptions, they actually have the same expression effect and can achieve a " The functions of "I checked in here" and "Say this sentence for me" are a modern "mouth substitute".

;

;Moreover, compared with the rigidity of plaques on ancient buildings, today’s street signs can be humorous and can also be customized with various golden sentences, making them more personalized and youthful in expression. , can better interact with the mood of young people.

;

;;

;

;;（IC photo/图）;

;

;;Are street signs so popular that they annoy people? ;

;

;It is worth noting that the large-scale imitation and transplantation of similar street signs in various places has also brought criticism to the popular street signs. Recently, the street signs installed by Zhejiang University, Central Academy of Fine Arts and other universities have been criticized by some freshmen. Some people said directly: "I don't even want to take a look at the Internet celebrity aura that comes to my face." Others said euphemistically: "It feels a bit out of class."

;

; Moreover, as the number of Internet celebrity street signs continues to increase, the installation of street signs in some areas also has the problem of illegal construction. Since July this year, Shanghai, Ningbo, Shiyan, Leshan and other places have removed such illegal "Internet celebrity street signs" placed on the roadside.

;

;Relevant staff from the Zoning and Place Names Office of Ningbo Municipal Civil Affairs Bureau of Zhejiang Province explained, "Road name plates are a type of place name signs, which are national legal landmarks. It is also a kind of public facility and should be set up by the civil affairs department."

;

;Captain He of the Comprehensive Law Enforcement Squadron of the Pujiang County Comprehensive Administrative Law Enforcement Bureau in Jinhua, Zhejiang Province said, "These The size and shape are actually relatively close to, or basically the same as, the standard place name signs set up by the government’s civil affairs department. The Internet celebrity street signs we manage are mainly for those set up along the street, and are actually a type of place name sign. ;

;It can be seen that if you just follow the trend without thinking and set up some Internet celebrity street signs in places such as universities and libraries, some of the styles do not match, and it may be wrong. Causing disgust. Secondly, if the road signs are installed by merchants themselves and named randomly, it is easy to mislead people to go the wrong way or find the wrong place, causing people to lose time and money.

;

;In this regard, Professor Gu, associate professor at Southeast University School of Law and public member of the Nanjing Urban Governance Committee, analyzed, “Internet celebrity street signs that hinder public order require relevant departments to promptly Intervention and regulation. However, it is also the goal of urban management to explore more and better cultural and creative solutions and Internet celebrity designs that can attract traffic and bring economic benefits while taking into account social responsibilities."

;

;In general, street signs that extend the traffic function can be viewed dialectically from multiple angles and optimize strategies. The presentation of street signs must, on the one hand, ensure the identification function of public facilities, and on the other hand, provide appropriate space for the presentation of "Internet celebrity street signs".

;

;While diverting traffic without interfering with public travel, this may be the development direction of characteristic road signs.

;

;Guangxi Guilin University of Electronic Science and Technology 2023 freshmen military training demonstration;(Visual China/Picture);

;

;Special Warfare Mode

;

;The alarm sounded, orange-red and white smoke staggered and dispersed, and the air was filled with sulfur smell.

;

;More than forty students wearing camouflage uniforms and holding model Type 95 rifles approached in batches from one side of the green field to the other. There are scattered fire rings made of cardboard boxes and obstacles covered with camouflage nets along the way. The advancers either suddenly fell down or rolled out of their guns to avoid the explosions flying from the opposite side. Every time he stopped neatly, he was still in the shooting posture, with the muzzle of the gun pointed at the "enemy camp" ahead.

;

;In this military training exercise, students acted as a special operations force of our country. Their mission at the moment is to board a strange border island to rescue the hostages held by terrorists. More than 20 people, including "hostages" and "robbers," were stationed under a camouflage awning on the other side of the playground.

;

;While advancing, we encountered stubborn resistance from the enemy. Many special forces "fell" and 7 "sacrificed". Medical soldiers wearing white armbands rushed into the smoke-filled battlefield in groups of four. The two in front held guns for cover, and the two behind carried the wounded onto stretchers for treatment.

;

;The robbers were equipped with more heavy firearms: a mortar and two rocket launchers. We only have one rocket launcher. When the battle was lost, the special forces issued a request for support. Subsequently, simulated armored vehicles and tanks manufactured at a 1:1 ratio were driven onto the playground one after another. With the support of solid barriers and mobile turrets, the special forces team successfully reached the enemy camp.

;

;Rescue soldiers and tanks have surrounded the enemy camp layer by layer, but the robbers are still guarding the "door". Our demolitions use directional blasts to blow up the stronghold. There was a loud noise and white light shot out. The hostages were finally rescued after rescue soldiers rushed in and engaged in close combat with the robbers.

;

;This is the military training meeting of Guilin Institute of Aerospace Industry (;hereinafter referred to as "Guihang";) on September 27 The finale of the parade ceremony: the performance of the special warfare phalanx. Long after the performance ended, the applause and cheers of more than 5,000 freshmen in military training echoed throughout the playground.

;

;The flame of excitement burned in Instructor Zhang. As the instructor of the special operations phalanx and the planner of the special operations performance, he also participated in the "rescue operation" and played the role of a special forces commander. Instructor Zhang’s skin was dark, his face was covered with sweat, and the gray and green colors of his camouflage makeup blurred together. He spoke breathlessly and in an uplifting tone. When he asked questions to the team members who were resting on the floor, he always received resounding answers and hearty laughter.

;

;Instructor Zhang is a militia member of the Guilin Garrison Area. After retiring from the armed police, he worked as a special warfare training instructor at a military training summer camp in Guangdong for four years.

;

;Different from conventional military training, special warfare training imitates the training of our country's special forces, selecting the most elite "soldiers" and adding subjects such as tactical movements, weapon operation, and wilderness survival. It is more intense and difficult. Instructor Zhang firmly believes that "this kind of education method can truly temper students' bodies and spirits."

;

;The educational concept of "barbaring one's body" is sometimes accompanied by more voices of incomprehension. Once upon a time, there was a young man who came from Zhejiang for training, and he always practiced gun-holding movements perfunctorily. In order to urge him, Instructor Zhang couldn't help but said some harsh words: "If you can't hold a gun well, then you don't need to eat." As a result, his parents scolded him.

;

;"I'm not denying him food, I just want him to experience setbacks and growth. Training is not the purpose. The important thing is to let students learn the valuable qualities of self-improvement, self-reliance, and self-confidence." Instructor Zhang remembered that when he first joined the army At that time, because I was not holding the gun properly, I was ordered to do the same thing by the squad leader for a whole morning. After that, he practiced diligently and became a model in the army's tactical training.

;

;However, in Guihang, Instructor Zhang rarely has the trouble of not being understood - the special team members are tougher than he imagined. Among Guihang's 5,000 freshmen participating in the training, more than 80 students from various military training camps passed the selection of height and physical fitness, and finally completed the study and performance of tactics, shooting and other projects. Even if you wear protective gear, rolling, climbing and other actions will inevitably cause arm and leg abrasions. But most people are enthusiastic. Instructor Zhang recalled that a classmate from the Sixth Battalion of the special operations team had a serious muscle strain. After a day of rest, his symptoms improved and he immediately returned to the team for training.

;

;The real battlefield will not leave opportunities to lax soldiers. All the training of the special operations team are highly simulated battlefields. The human ladder construction training is to restore the scene of three people fighting together. Gun training simulates a quick response to an enemy attack. "The simulated gun is relatively heavy, and the students are naughty and occasionally deliberately distort the movement of the gun." Instructor Zhang will seriously teach him: "When encountering a real attack, the gun must be drawn within 1 second or even 0.1 seconds. The movements must be crisp and clear, and the eyes must be clean." You have to be keen, otherwise you will be a lamb waiting to be slaughtered."

;

;About 10% of the people who initially signed up to join the special forces team dropped out. "Special warfare training requires very high physical fitness. Carrying a 1:1 scale simulated rifle that is almost as heavy as a real gun (;95 (The weight of the rifle is 3.25kg;) to complete tactical actions, some people are not physically fit enough to do the standard."

;

;Only the special operations team has the opportunity to come into contact with the simulated gun, and students from other companies will start to purely Yu signed up to join the special training team out of curiosity about firearms. Instructor Zhang does not encourage such people to stay because "they are not interested in the special training itself. They just want to take pictures with tanks and armored vehicles. They cannot accept the hard training and cannot keep up with the pace." In his opinion, only the students themselves are active With participation and cooperation, hard-core training and realistic performances will not be in name only.

;

;;

;

;Special warfare phalanx display during Guihang military training exhibition;(provided by interviewee/picture);

;

;National Defense Enthusiasts

;

;As night falls, the mountains surrounding the campus gradually disappear, the singing of the Mid-Autumn Festival Gala rehearsal is endless, and the lake is full of students running around it. It’s an ordinary Tuesday night at the Huajiang Campus of Guilin University of Electronic Science and Technology (;hereinafter referred to as "Guidian";).

;

;Through the lively playground and stage, in the quiet square, more than 20 members of the Patriotic National Defense Education Association are conducting their daily training. This is a club composed of enthusiasts of national defense knowledge and military training in Guidian. They often participate in the school's national defense education activities and usually maintain at least two hours of tactical training a week.

;

;In addition to wearing camouflage uniforms, the team members also wore simulated guns, tactical helmets, marching bags, protective gear, and military boots, just like troops going out to perform missions. They are all students participating in this year's military training for freshmen. At this time, two weeks have passed since the end of the Guidian military training camp.

;

;Since its establishment in 2019, the Patriotic National Defense Education Association has selected students who are determined to participate in tactical training for a long time from each new military training class and regularly conducted daily training on infantry combat skills. The core personnel who have undergone long-term training will assist the instructors in completing the tactical training for new students in the second year of military training. In the 2023 Guidian freshmen military training, 150 students from the tactical company were assigned to provide guidance to 30 members of the 21st and 22nd level associations. The person in charge pointed out that this kind of small class teaching can improve the efficiency of training.

;

;Many of the participants in the association have the idea of ​​joining the military or the police. Lin Yu, who served as the gunner of the anti-tank team in this military training, applied for the police academy as her first choice in the college entrance examination. Joining the tactical team satisfied her childhood desire to operate firearms. Shen Hong serves as an industrial infantryman responsible for demining. His father was a soldier. Shen Hong's favorite TV drama character is Li Yunlong. He believes that this tactical training has given him a lot of knowledge and strengthened his ambition to join the army.

;

;"Fend off the enemy from the front." As the squad leader issued the order, the members of the seven-person platoon quickly completed squatting, turning over, and crawling from the stance of marching with guns, with their guns pointing forward. After hearing "defend the enemy from the rear", the members who were running forward suddenly turned around, slid sideways and lay down, with their guns pointed at the rear. This is an individual soldier action exercise, the association’s most basic training program.

;

;Huang Yilong, chairman and founder of the association and a preparatory class for the children of border guards in 2019, is supervising the training of members. He reminded the squad leader to take the members to a venue without glass ballast to prevent scratches caused by the huge friction with the ground. When Lin Yu fulfilled the command to "lie down while running", his movements were not coherent enough. Huang Yilonglue jokingly urged the squad leader to correct Lin Yu's actions. He explained to a reporter from Southern People Weekly, "She slowed down first and then lay down. It was too slow. Now she is dead in the actual combat state. You can see that other people slid down directly from the high speed. She almost slowed down." If I go on to 0, I will still be afraid."

;

;When talking about the essentials and operational significance of various military actions, Huang Yilong always speaks very fast. He can talk about the "three-point running and shooting position change" in team operations and the obstacle breaking training of the engineering chemical defense team like an encyclopedia. Huang Yilong grew up in a military compound and liked to study various military tactics on his own. He started participating in military clubs in high school. This hobby continued into college and became an ambition. "After graduation, I will either join the army or plunge into research in the military field. I will not be so comfortable doing other jobs."

;

;The plan for the 2023 Guidian military training and the tactical confrontation performance of the red and blue squares is Huang Yilong and the leaders of the training units jointly completed the planning. "Our first tactical display in 2021 will be more conservative, with only infantry and pure attackers. This year, with armored vehicles, blasting tubes and other equipment, we can display more complex tactics, and we have designed offensive and defensive confrontation, engineer barbed wire breaking obstacles and other links."

;

;According to Huang Yilong, the military training exercises in Guihang, a ten-minute drive from Guidian, also made reference to this tactical confrontation model. "Guihang's Military Enthusiasts Association is a fraternal association with us and shares some promotional materials and equipment resources. At the beginning of their association's establishment, we helped them organize some training. This year, we also seconded guns to Guihang's freshmen military training. Give it to them."

;

;As for the next step in the development of the association, Huang Yilong hopes to form a mutual aid community with more military hobby societies in local universities to exchange more experiences in tactical training. In addition, he plans to enrich tactical training projects. "In the beginning we only had simple training on advancing, kneeling and sliding, and fending off enemies. Later we went up the mountain and carried out infiltration and counter-infiltration operations in the forest. There may be new development directions in the future."

;

;< img src="http://images.infzm.com/cms/medias/image/23/10/18/VpLyIkjRdB9o98kmFtnycQIKGic5OP5m1r3hIaR3.jpg" border="0" width="960" height="540" data-src=" //images.infzm.com/cms/medias/image/23/10/18/VpLyIkjRdB9o98kmFtnycQIKGic5OP5m1r3hIaR3.jpg" data-key="254442">;

;

;Guidian Patriotic National Defense Education Association conducts woodland infiltration and counter-infiltration training near the school;(provided by interviewee/picture);

;

;Resources and Culture

;

;It takes about 50 minutes to drive from Guilin North Railway Station in the direction of Yaoshan Scenic Area to reach Guihang and Guidian. They are only one stop apart on the route of bus number 13.

;

;Both schools are surrounded by mountains, covering vast areas, far away from the bustling city, and seem to be specially designed for Qing Dynasty. Unless it is a holiday, there are few vehicles passing by on the mountain roads surrounding the school. In the nearby Yaoshan Scenic Area, there are dense forests and gentle slopes. The surrounding environment provides the school with a suitable place for field training and simulated jungle combat.

;

;Guihang chose Yaoshan for training. The person in charge of the school's armed forces department explained, "With more than 5,000 people training, safety is the first priority. In addition, we must also meet everyone's needs for exercise, so we walked to the mountains where there are few cars." The members of the special operations team used trees and grass to For cover, they wore gas masks and simulated woodland infiltration, jungle manhunts and other activities.

;

;The supply of military training equipment benefits from cooperation between universities and between universities and military institutions.

;

;Guidian’s imitation armored vehicles and rocket launchers are all seconded from Guilin Military Expo Park. Staff of the Military Expo Park revealed that Guidian’s national flag guard team will also come to the Military Expo Park to perform. The simulated guns and gas masks were loaned from the Army Special Warfare College. You Jiangjiao, chief of the Comprehensive Section of the Guidian Armed Forces Department, said that over three days, nearly 10,000 military training students took turns to experience shooting simulated guns. Guidian, the current deputy minister of the Armed Forces, once worked at the Army Special Warfare Academy. In order for the performance to go smoothly, he took the initiative to help the students borrow 55 marching bags from a unit in Qifeng Town. Some of the simulated mortars, tanks, firearms and other equipment used in Guihang's military training are provided by the school's military associations, and some are seconded from the Guilin Garrison District. Guidian, Guilin and other universities will also lend some equipment.

;

;In recent years, real gun and live ammunition shooting in military training in colleges and universities has gradually been replaced by simulated gun shooting. You Jiangjiao pointed out, "Shooting with real guns is too dangerous. The real guns borrowed by the school are mainly disassembled for students to learn."

;

;Teachers from the armed forces departments of the two schools believe that the school's emphasis on military training Investing more resources will help enhance students’ national defense awareness and promote military recruitment.

;

;As part of national defense education, military training is also a window for ordinary students to understand the life of the army. The person in charge of the Guihang Armed Forces Department once conducted a post-training survey on the students of the school. He found that the previous military training, which had a single form and lacked equipment support, made many students question the meaning of military training: "If the military training showed students all about going forward and standing in military postures, they would also find military life boring like this. It is difficult to yearn for the army. Military training adds activities such as tactical training and enriches the form to more comprehensively reflect the real life in the military camp and allow students to understand the specific needs of national defense. This can inspire their enthusiasm and belief in joining the army."

;

;Li Ming, a retired soldier from the Guilin Garrison District, has a military dream that was cultivated by the military training experience he witnessed in his childhood. His parents are teachers at Guilin Forestry School. Since elementary school, Li Ming has often observed the military training of this technical secondary school after school. At that time, the use of firearms accounted for a large proportion of military training courses, and Li Ming, who was watching from the sidelines, was always clamoring to play with firearms. When Li Ming was in junior high school, instructor Chen often came to this school to train students. He often played with Li Ming, who was unwilling to do homework, and taught him a lot of military knowledge.

;

;One day, Instructor Chen accidentally broke his arm while demonstrating a certain movement. Other instructors quickly rushed forward to check the wound and sent Instructor Chen to the infirmary. This scene deeply inspired Li Ming: "I am an only child born in the 1990s. I can only cry alone when I am injured. When the instructor is injured, his comrades are a solid backing. We study with peace of mind, and the soldiers are also our backing, protecting everyone and the children. The safety of my home." Li Ming determined to be a soldier who can become the backing of the country.

;

;Today, he is also an instructor at Guihang Military Training. He hopes that the seeds that instructor Chen once planted in his heart will also be planted in the hearts of Guihang students.

;

;Is hard-core military training suitable for more people?

;

;The resources of the special operations training model cannot benefit everyone who participates in military training. Among the more than 5,000 freshmen participating in the training at Guihang, except for more than 80 members of the special operations team, other students rarely have the opportunity to come into contact with simulated firearms. Courses on square formations such as split formation and prisoner boxing are still based on formation training. For safety reasons, those who drive armored vehicles and tanks are instructors who have obtained driver's licenses. Students can only take photos with these models or sit on them to experience them.

;

;A classmate of the split company felt a little regretful that he did not have the courage to sign up for the special operations company: "Although it is more difficult, I can also learn a lot of military skills and experience more military life. It's a pity that I I wear glasses. During the selection, the instructor said that the movements may break the glasses, and those wearing glasses cannot participate. In addition, there are height requirements, and those with martial arts and dance foundations are given priority. I don’t seem to be good enough."

;

;Wang Zhipeng, a lecturer in the Military Teaching and Research Office of Xi'an Jiaotong University, said that the emergence of special training models in military training is to meet the military training needs of different types of students: "In recent years, colleges and universities have expanded their enrollment, and the number of participants has continued to increase. The physical fitness and adaptability of students have There are differences, and some high-intensity training may not be suitable for all students. Similar activities are also held in the national student military training camps organized by the Ministry of Education and the National Defense Mobilization Department of the Central Military Commission to provide students with good physical fitness and deep national defense sentiments. A platform for growth, experience and advancement."

;

;In addition to the threshold of student quality, special warfare training itself also has higher requirements for resources such as venues and equipment.

;

;The biggest headache for instructor Zhang, who is in charge of Guihang’s special training, is the lack of softer training venues. During special training and movements such as rolling and lying down, the hard cement floor will aggravate the students' scratches. However, the plastic badminton court on Guihang South Campus cannot be used because it is close to classrooms for other grades. The playground with a 400-meter track in the North Campus needs to be shared by 7 camps. Instructor Zhang sometimes felt a little crowded, so he had to take the team to a corner of the playground for training. They had only rehearsed the full tactical display with ample space once.

;

;Guidian’s way of solving the problem is to make full use of the roads on campus. You Jiangjiao pointed out, "By clearing the electric vehicles parked on the road to one side, the area of ​​the training venue can be increased, and the separated teams can train here."

;

;Universities such as Guihang and Guidian, It has a military-industrial nature, and it is more convenient to communicate with the local military region and borrow resources such as simulated firearms during military training. But in general colleges and universities, it is relatively difficult to borrow. Xi'an Jiaotong University's approach is for the school to purchase its own military training teaching aids. The special training team always has more than 40 model guns, and other students can only get 2-3 guns per company on average. The average price of a model gun is a few hundred yuan. If it is to ensure that every student participating in the training has one like a special training team, it will also be a big expense for a school that provides military training for five to six thousand freshmen.

;

;Wang Zhipeng believes that the implementation of the compulsory content required by the "Military Course Syllabus for General Colleges and Universities" (;such as light weapons shooting, battlefield medical treatment First aid, etc.;), so that more ordinary students can have the experience of hard-core military training, it is necessary to "increase resource investment, strengthen policy supply, and create a professional team of national defense education teachers. At the same time, teaching must incorporate the latest technologies VR, The introduction of informatization and intelligent equipment such as drones into military training will enhance the four flavors of military training, namely fun, military flavor, war flavor and technological flavor, and improve student participation and educational effect."

;

;The "State Council's Notice on Cancellation and Adjustment of a Group of Decision on Fine Matters" and "Regulations on Human Organ Donation and Transplantation (Revised Draft)"

;

;Premier Li Qiang chaired an executive meeting of the State Council on October 20 to review and adopt the "State Council's Notice on Cancellation and Adjustment of a Group of Fine Matters" Decision" and "Human Organ Donation and Transplantation Regulations (Revised Draft)".

;

;The meeting pointed out that strictly regulating penalties and fine standards is an important measure to optimize the business environment and reduce operating costs. It is necessary to continue to reduce fines and reduce fines that violate legal authority, do not meet the needs of economic and social development, and can be managed in other ways. It is necessary to strictly regulate the discretionary power of administrative penalties, intensify efforts to rectify arbitrary fines, improve collaborative governance and joint punishment mechanisms, seriously investigate and punish behaviors such as the administration of fines and excessive fines, increase exposure to the society, and prevent all types of benefits. The effect of corporate policies is weakened or offset. Efforts should be made to strengthen interim and ex-post supervision, improve supervision methods, standardize supervision procedures, improve supervision efficiency, and effectively strengthen supervision in key areas such as production safety, life and health, and product quality, so as to provide strong support for promoting high-quality development. According to the meeting's deliberations, it is planned to cancel and adjust 33 fines in administrative regulations and departmental rules as a package.

;

;The meeting emphasized that human organ donation and transplantation are acts of great love and charity in the world, related to the lives and health of the people, bioethics and social justice, and are an important symbol of the development of national medicine and the progress of social civilization. We must put people and life first, further regulate human organ donation and transplantation, ensure the quality of medical care, protect human health, and safeguard the legitimate rights and interests of citizens. It is necessary to take this revision of the regulations as an opportunity to strengthen legal protection, establish a full-process traceability and supervision mechanism, strengthen the construction of the organ donation work system, strengthen the ethical review of organ procurement, crack down on and investigate organ-related crimes in accordance with the law, and better protect the organ donation and The transplantation industry is developing healthily.

;

;Other matters were also considered at the meeting.
